title:
Designing single and degenerate flat bands in the Kagome lattice with
  long-range hopping
authors: Yuta Taguchi, Motoaki Hirayama, Takashi Miyake
abstract:
We investigate the electronic structure of the kagome lattice model with
first, second, and two kinds of third nearest-neighbor hoppings. We reveal that
by tuning the third nearest-neighbor hoppings, not only single flat band but
also degenerate flat band can be created on the \Gamma - M line. We provide the
detailed conditions to realize them. The coexistence of these bands can be
almost realized near the fundamental band gap in graphene with triangular
defects in a superhoneycomb arrangement. Our results strongly indicate that
long-range electron hopping has a new possibility for designing electronic
structures.
